medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 weeks before admission with decreased energy and a change in mood. The patient described feeling as if he was 'living in a fog.' Three weeks before admission, he lost his way while driving, and 9 days before admission, he forgot to visit his aunt. He expressed confusion about his whereabouts when contacted by telephone.
medical_history.family_history: An aunt had Alzheimer's disease; parents died late in life; three sisters are alive and well
medical_history.social_history: Never married, worked as a supervisor in the shipbuilding industry until retirement, camping enthusiast, does not smoke, rarely drinks alcohol, and has no known allergies or regular medications.
